title: CONTRIBUTING
text: Small typos grammatical errors documentation may edited directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. YES ✔️: edit roxygen comment .R file R/. ❌: edit .Rd file man/.

title: CONTRIBUTING
text: make substantial pull request, always file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s problem. ’ve found bug, create associated issue illustrate bug minimal reprex.

title: CONTRIBUTING
text: recommend create Git branch pull request (PR). Look R-CMD-check build status . making changes, run devtools::check() ensure new Notes, Warnings Errors appearing. recommend tidyverse style guide. also use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2. use testthat. Contributions test cases included easier accept. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md current development version header describing changes made followed GitHub username, links relevant issue(s)/PR(s).

title: CONTRIBUTING
text: Email person listed maintainer DESCRIPTION file repo. Though note private discussions email don’t help others - course email totally warranted ’s sensitive problem kind.

title: CONTRIBUTING

title: Helper function for centralize API queries — arc_api_call
Helper function for centralize API queries — arc_api_call
text: url character string (longer vector     "libcurl" method) naming URL resource     downloaded. destfile character string (vector, see url     argument) file path downloaded file     saved.  Tilde-expansion performed. quiet TRUE, suppress status messages (),     progress bar.

title: Helper function for centralize API queries — arc_api_call
text: logical TRUE/FALSE

what: Reverse Geocoding using the ArcGIS REST API — arc_reverse_geo
title: Reverse Geocoding using the ArcGIS REST API — arc_reverse_geo
text: Generates address latitude longitude. Latitudes must [-90, 90] longitudes [-180, 180]. function returns tibble associated query.

title: Reverse Geocoding using the ArcGIS REST API — arc_reverse_geo
code: arc_reverse_geo(   lat,   long,   address = "address",   full_results = FALSE,   return_coords = TRUE,   verbose = FALSE,   progressbar = TRUE,   custom_query = list() )

title: Reverse Geocoding using the ArcGIS REST API — arc_reverse_geo
text: lat latitude values numeric format. Must range [-90, 90]. long longitude values numeric format. Must range [-180, 180]. address address column name output data (default  "address"). full_results returns available data API service. FALSE (default) latitude, longitude address columns returned. return_coords return input coordinates results TRUE. verbose TRUE detailed logs output console. progressbar Logical. TRUE displays progress bar indicate progress function. custom_query API-specific parameters used, passed named list (.e. list(featureTypes = "POI")). See Details.

title: Reverse Geocoding using the ArcGIS REST API — arc_reverse_geo
text: tibble results.

title: Reverse Geocoding using the ArcGIS REST API — arc_reverse_geo
text: See https://developers.arcgis.com/rest/geocode/api-reference/geocoding-reverse-geocode.htm additional parameters passed custom_query.

title: Reverse Geocoding using the ArcGIS REST API — arc_reverse_geo
code: # \donttest{  arc_reverse_geo(lat = 40.75728, long = -73.98586) #> # A tibble: 1 × 3 #>   address                               lat   lon #>   <chr>                               <dbl> <dbl> #> 1 W 44th St, New York, NY, 10036, USA  40.8 -74.0  # Several coordinates arc_reverse_geo(lat = c(40.75728, 55.95335), long = c(-73.98586, -3.188375)) #>    |                                                           |                                                  |   0%   |                                                           |=========================                         |  50%   |                                                           |==================================================| 100% #> # A tibble: 2 × 3 #>   address                                       lat    lon #>   <chr>                                       <dbl>  <dbl> #> 1 W 44th St, New York, NY, 10036, USA          40.8 -74.0  #> 2 Old Town Chambers, Edinburgh, Scotland, GBR  56.0  -3.19  # With options: zoom to country level sev <- arc_reverse_geo(   lat = c(40.75728, 55.95335), long = c(-73.98586, -3.188375),   custom_query = list(featureTypes = "StreetInt,POI", langCode = "FR"),   verbose = TRUE, full_results = TRUE ) #>    |                                                           |                                                  |   0%   |                                                           |=========================                         |  50%   |                                                           |==================================================| 100%  dplyr::glimpse(sev) #> Rows: 2 #> Columns: 27 #> $ address      <chr> "W 44th St & Broadway, New York, NY, 10036, USA", "Old To… #> $ lat          <dbl> 40.75732, 55.95325 #> $ lon          <dbl> -73.98596, -3.18827 #> $ Match_addr   <chr> "W 44th St & Broadway, New York, New York, 10036", "Old T… #> $ LongLabel    <chr> "W 44th St & Broadway, New York, NY, 10036, USA", "Old To… #> $ ShortLabel   <chr> "W 44th St & Broadway", "Old Town Chambers" #> $ Addr_type    <chr> "StreetInt", "POI" #> $ Type         <chr> "", "Hotel" #> $ PlaceName    <chr> "", "Old Town Chambers" #> $ AddNum       <chr> "", "" #> $ Address      <chr> "W 44th St & Broadway", "" #> $ Block        <chr> "", "" #> $ Sector       <chr> "", "" #> $ Neighborhood <chr> "Theater District-Times Square", "" #> $ District     <chr> "Manhattan", "" #> $ City         <chr> "New York", "" #> $ MetroArea    <chr> "New York City Metro", "" #> $ Subregion    <chr> "New York County", "Edinburgh" #> $ Region       <chr> "New York", "Scotland" #> $ RegionAbbr   <chr> "NY", "" #> $ Territory    <chr> "", "" #> $ Postal       <chr> "10036", "" #> $ PostalExt    <chr> "", "" #> $ CntryName    <chr> "United States", "United Kingdom" #> $ CountryCode  <chr> "USA", "GBR" #> $ wkid         <int> 4326, 4326 #> $ latestWkid   <int> 4326, 4326 # }
